abstract: Investors holding 24 percent of shares in the videoconferencing company Tandberg snubbed a $3 billion bid from Cisco Systems, hoping to force the network equipment maker to offer more.
snippet: Investors holding 24 percent of shares in the videoconferencing company Tandberg snubbed a $3 billion bid from Cisco Systems, hoping to force the network equipment maker to offer more.
lead_paragraph: Investors holding 24 percent of shares in the Norwegian videoconferencing company Tandberg snubbed a $3 billion bid from Cisco Systems, hoping they could force the network equipment maker to offer more money, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Investors Call Cisco’s Offer for Tandberg Too Low
